content:
I've had this issue several times. The most successful way that I've solved it is to delete all the .msf files in your profile (for goodness sake, back up the folder first!!), then restart TB & do compact all folders. I had just this problem again last week & now TB running much better.

I also have occasional problems with both TB & FF hanging. This is almost always due to rf-chrome-nm-host (32bit) which is something to do with Roboform (password saver). Been using RF for years & have had this issue on & off for years, but have learned to live with it. Just go to Task Manager & end process for that. Restart FF & I'm away

Hope that helps
creator: deb36

content: That happens because the account is IMAP and each time Thunderbird issues a save, a new copy is created. To avoid that, set your drafts folder to Local Folders instead.
creator: davidsk

content:
I generally recommend that, when setting up a second PC, to just copy the working setup from the first PC.

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer, started once and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This WILL prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it 
#   start thunderbird and all should be there

The second PC should be equal or NEWER than the first PC. That is, copying to a newer version is good, copying to an older version is not.
creator: davidsk

content:
I don't completely understand your description, but as far as I know, the "Send Later" button is only available when you are in offline mode. If you are online, that button is replaced by the "Send" button. Check the menu option <File | Offline> and see of "Work offline" is checked.

This also might happen if you lose network connectivity.
creator: rednoise

content: Is the Composition Toolbar visible? If it's hidden, you can reveal it from the Write window menu <View | Toolbars>. If the toolbar is visible but the Send button is missing, you can add it by choosing Customize from the above menu. Buttons can be dragged onto and off of the toolbar from there.

creator: rickfoulke

content:
rickfoulke said
It is an Imap acct.

Then technically if you have already shut down the account you have lost the emails involved.

It might be possible to recover some but probably not all of the relevant email by copying the base files before Thunderbird gets done deleting everything.

  1. GO to the troubleshooting information on the help menu.
  2. Click on the show profile button.
  3. Close Thunderbird
  4. In the Windows file manager window that opened copy the folder "IMAP mail" and all of it's sub folders to another location (desktop USB dive. The where is not important.
  5. Open Thunderbird.
  6. Install this addon https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/?src=ss
  7. from a folder in local folder, right click and select ImportExportToolNG >import MBOX files > All MBOX fiules from a directory with structure.
  8. When asked point to the IMAP mail folder you copied to the backup location

Eventually the import will import all IMAP mail you copied not necessarily from just the account you closed but being with structure will allow you to determine which accounts belong with which folders.

Now you have a local backup and can work with it however you like.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
That sounds unusual. If the profile worked in another thunderbird, then it will work here. My guess is there is a difference in version numbers and there may be a compatibility.ini file that could be deleted. Your current problem is that you moved the default profile, so when thunderbird tries to start, it's not there. I would place the thunderbird folder back in place and try again. If you get an error message, please post it. here are my normal steps:

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer, started once and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This WILL prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it 
#   start thunderbird and all should be there

HOWEVER

If your backup is just the profile itself, then do this:

  1. install thunderbird on new pc, downloaded from thunderbird.net
  2. in receiving PC, click help>troubleshootinginformation
  3. scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'
  4. exit thunderbird
  5. now, paste contents of exported profile, overlaying contents of profile.
  6. if there is a compatibility.ini file, delete it
  7. restart thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content: This has been an ongoing problem for many years. I've complained about it here and so have others. It seems to be some undesirable interaction between Google Calendar, Google Contacts, and Thunderbird. Calendar notifications can be turned off in Thunderbird, but that takes away much of the utility of the calendar in the first place. As far as I know there is no definitive explanation, and no real solution. But if somebody has one, I'm all ears.

content: I think I would be using a filter. These do have some tendency to time out what large quantities of mail are involved, but you can just run them again tomorrow and get the "next batch" it is also a really good idea to only have windows defender active while moving large quantities of IMAP mail. It reduces the timeout caused by scanning
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Your speed is very slow. I just moved about 2000 messages from one IMAP folder to another IMAP folder in less than ten seconds. As Matt wonders, is anti-virus software causing the slowness?

You could use saved search folders, one for each sender. That should segregate messages by sender quickly, but it would not move messages physically out of the inbox.

Some e-mail service providers allow users to download messages through a browser instead of in the e-mail client. That might be faster. But then you would want to import those messages into local folders and work with them from there. May not be the workflow that you want.
creator: mozilla98

content: Answered at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1568231#answer-1802852.
creator: siffemoz

content:
This is how I've always done it (Windows). It preserves your whole existing setup.

Copy TB files from the old PC

- launch TB on the old PC

- go to TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information

- click the Application Basics > Profile Folder 'Open Folder' button

- the profile folder will open

- navigate three levels up to the AppData\Roaming folder

- close TB

- copy the AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird folder to a flash drive

---

Install and launch TB on the new PC, then start setting up the new profile. Skip to the next section if you've already installed TB and created a profile.

- on the 'Set Up Your Existing Email Address' screen, enter name and email address only

- click the 'Configure manually' link

- scroll down and click 'Cancel'

- exit setup

- close TB

---

Paste the copied TB files to the new PC

- open the AppData\Roaming folder like you did above

- delete the Thunderbird folder, or copy it somewhere if you want to save it

- replace it with the Thunderbird folder from the flash drive

- launch TB
creator: siffemoz

content: Answered at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1568231#answer-1802852.
creator: siffemoz

content: Go to TB menu > Account Settings and make sure one of your accounts is set as default - button on top right corner. It will be grayed out for the default account, and available for other accounts.
creator: siffemoz
